trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting the Access Panel Extension for Internet Explorer | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting the Access Panel Extension for Internet Explorer | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to use group policy to deploy the Internet Explorer add-on for the My Apps portal.
trans-unit.target: How to use group policy to deploy the Internet Explorer add-on for the My Apps portal.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting the Access Panel Extension for Internet Explorer
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting the Access Panel Extension for Internet Explorer

trans-unit.source: This article will help you troubleshoot the following problems:
trans-unit.target: This article will help you troubleshoot the following problems:

trans-unit.source: You're unable to access your apps through the My Apps portal while using Internet Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You're unable to access your apps through the My Apps portal while using Internet Explorer.

trans-unit.source: You see the "Install Software" message even though you've already installed the software.
trans-unit.target: You see the "Install Software" message even though you've already installed the software.

trans-unit.source: If you are an admin, see also: [How to Deploy the Access Panel Extension for Internet Explorer using Group Policy](active-directory-saas-ie-group-policy.md)
trans-unit.target: If you are an admin, see also: [How to Deploy the Access Panel Extension for Internet Explorer using Group Policy](active-directory-saas-ie-group-policy.md)

trans-unit.source: Run the Diagnostic Tool
trans-unit.target: Run the Diagnostic Tool

trans-unit.source: You can diagnose installation problems with the Access Panel Extension by downloading and running the Access Panel diagnostic tool:
trans-unit.target: You can diagnose installation problems with the Access Panel Extension by downloading and running the Access Panel diagnostic tool:

trans-unit.source: Click here to download the diagnostic tool.
trans-unit.target: Click here to download the diagnostic tool.

trans-unit.source: Open the file, and press **Extract all** button.
trans-unit.target: Open the file, and press **Extract all** button.

trans-unit.source: Press Extract All
trans-unit.target: Press Extract All

trans-unit.source: Then press the **Extract** button to continue.
trans-unit.target: Then press the **Extract** button to continue.

trans-unit.source: Press Extract
trans-unit.target: Press Extract

trans-unit.source: To run the tool, right-click the file named **AccessPanelExtensionDiagnosticTool**, then select **Open with > Microsoft Windows Based Script Host**.
trans-unit.target: To run the tool, right-click the file named **AccessPanelExtensionDiagnosticTool**, then select **Open with > Microsoft Windows Based Script Host**.

trans-unit.source: Open with > Microsoft Windows Based Script Host
trans-unit.target: Open with > Microsoft Windows Based Script Host

trans-unit.source: You will then see the following diagnostic window, which describes what might be wrong with your installation.
trans-unit.target: You will then see the following diagnostic window, which describes what might be wrong with your installation.

trans-unit.source: A sample of the diagnostic window
trans-unit.target: A sample of the diagnostic window

trans-unit.source: Click "**YES**" to let the program fix the issues that have been found.
trans-unit.target: Click "**YES**" to let the program fix the issues that have been found.

trans-unit.source: To save these changes, close every Internet Explorer window, and then open Internet Explorer again.
trans-unit.target: To save these changes, close every Internet Explorer window, and then open Internet Explorer again.

trans-unit.source: If you still can't access your apps, try the steps below.
trans-unit.target: If you still can't access your apps, try the steps below.

trans-unit.source: Check that the Access Panel Extension is enabled
trans-unit.target: Check that the Access Panel Extension is enabled

trans-unit.source: To verify that the Access Panel Extension is enabled in Internet Explorer:
trans-unit.target: To verify that the Access Panel Extension is enabled in Internet Explorer:

trans-unit.source: In Internet Explorer, click on the **Gear icon** on the top right corner of the window.
trans-unit.target: In Internet Explorer, click on the **Gear icon** on the top right corner of the window.

trans-unit.source: Then select **Internet options**.
trans-unit.target: Then select **Internet options**.

trans-unit.source: (In older versions of Internet Explorer you can find this under **Tools > Internet options**.
trans-unit.target: (In older versions of Internet Explorer you can find this under **Tools > Internet options**.

trans-unit.source: Go to Tools > Internet Options
trans-unit.target: Go to Tools > Internet Options

trans-unit.source: Click on the **Programs** tab, then click on the **Manage add-ons** button.
trans-unit.target: Click on the **Programs** tab, then click on the **Manage add-ons** button.

trans-unit.source: Click Manage Add-Ons
trans-unit.target: Click Manage Add-Ons

trans-unit.source: In this dialog, select **Access Panel Extension** and then click the **Enable** button.
trans-unit.target: In this dialog, select **Access Panel Extension** and then click the **Enable** button.

trans-unit.source: Click Enable
trans-unit.target: Click Enable

trans-unit.source: To save these changes, close every Internet Explorer window and then open Internet Explorer again.
trans-unit.target: To save these changes, close every Internet Explorer window and then open Internet Explorer again.

trans-unit.source: Enable Extensions for InPrivate Browsing
trans-unit.target: Enable Extensions for InPrivate Browsing

trans-unit.source: If you are using the InPrivate Browsing mode:
trans-unit.target: If you are using the InPrivate Browsing mode:

trans-unit.source: In Internet Explorer, click on the **Gear icon** on the top right corner of the window.
trans-unit.target: In Internet Explorer, click on the **Gear icon** on the top right corner of the window.

trans-unit.source: Then select **Internet options**.
trans-unit.target: Then select **Internet options**.

trans-unit.source: (In older versions of Internet Explorer you can find this under **Tools > Internet options**.
trans-unit.target: (In older versions of Internet Explorer you can find this under **Tools > Internet options**.

trans-unit.source: A sample of the diagnostic window
trans-unit.target: A sample of the diagnostic window

trans-unit.source: Go to the **Privacy** tab, then **uncheck** the checkbox labeled **Disable toolbars and extensions when InPrivate Browsing starts**
trans-unit.target: Go to the **Privacy** tab, then **uncheck** the checkbox labeled **Disable toolbars and extensions when InPrivate Browsing starts**

trans-unit.source: Uncheck Disable toolbars and extensions when InPrivate Browsing starts
trans-unit.target: Uncheck Disable toolbars and extensions when InPrivate Browsing starts

trans-unit.source: To save these changes, close every Internet Explorer window and then open Internet Explorer again.
trans-unit.target: To save these changes, close every Internet Explorer window and then open Internet Explorer again.

trans-unit.source: Uninstall the Access Panel Extension
trans-unit.target: Uninstall the Access Panel Extension

trans-unit.source: To uninstall the Access Panel extension from your computer:
trans-unit.target: To uninstall the Access Panel extension from your computer:

trans-unit.source: On your keyboard, press the **Windows key** to open the Start menu.
trans-unit.target: On your keyboard, press the **Windows key** to open the Start menu.

trans-unit.source: When the menu is open, you can type anything to do a search.
trans-unit.target: When the menu is open, you can type anything to do a search.

trans-unit.source: Type "Control Panel" and then open the **Control Panel** when it appears in the search results.
trans-unit.target: Type "Control Panel" and then open the **Control Panel** when it appears in the search results.

trans-unit.source: Search for Control Panel
trans-unit.target: Search for Control Panel

trans-unit.source: In the top right corner of the Control Panel, change the **View by** option to **Large icons**.
trans-unit.target: In the top right corner of the Control Panel, change the **View by** option to **Large icons**.

trans-unit.source: Then find and click on the **Programs and Features** button.
trans-unit.target: Then find and click on the **Programs and Features** button.

trans-unit.source: Chang the view to show Large Icons
trans-unit.target: Chang the view to show Large Icons

trans-unit.source: From the list, select **Access Panel Extension**, and the click on the **Uninstall** button.
trans-unit.target: From the list, select **Access Panel Extension**, and the click on the **Uninstall** button.

trans-unit.source: Click Uninstall
trans-unit.target: Click Uninstall

trans-unit.source: You can then try to install the extension again to see if the problem has been resolved.
trans-unit.target: You can then try to install the extension again to see if the problem has been resolved.

trans-unit.source: If you encounter issues uninstalling the extension, you can also remove it using the [Microsoft Fix It](https://go.microsoft.com/?linkid=9779673) tool.
trans-unit.target: If you encounter issues uninstalling the extension, you can also remove it using the [Microsoft Fix It](https://go.microsoft.com/?linkid=9779673) tool.
